Presenting, VÃƒÂ­ctor Erice's spellbinding The Spirit of the Beehive (El espÃƒÂ­ritu de la colmena), widely regarded as the greatest Spanish film of the 1970s. In a small Castilian village in 1940, in the wake of the country's devastating civil war, six-year-old Ana attends a traveling movie show of Frankenstein and becomes possessed by the memory of it. Produced as Franco?s long regime was nearing its end, The Spirit of the Beehive is a bewitching portrait of a child?s haunted inner life and one of the most visually arresting movies ever made.
